scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder comprises letters; telegrams; a bill for dry goods purchased at William Holloway's in Lexington, Kentucky; and typewritten excerpts from The History of Chudleigh, Devon by Mary Jones containing notes on the Hunt family. The majority of the letters are addressed to Calvin Cogswell Morgan, and three letters are written to C.C. Hunt and his business partner, Henry P. McGrath. Two of the letters written to McGrath and Morgan are from Abram D. Hunt and Co., Morgan's uncle's company, discussing an error in a note and its later correction. Correspondence from H.P. McGrath discusses hemp sales and shipping. Correspondence from J.L. Robinson and R.W. Woolly in New York City discusses betting and horse races.
